title: How to collect suite logs
content:
The system saves suite logs on persistent volumes. You can collect suite logs manually using the SMA Support Assistant.

This solution supports embedded Kubernetes and managed Kubernetes environments with different types of storage such as NFS, EFS, or StorageClass.

Prerequisite 

Follow the instructions here to install the Support Assistant. 

Collect logs

  1. Enter the itom-toolkit container and find the correct log paths by running the following commands on the control plane node or the bastion node:

    ns=<ESM_NAMESPACE>
# Enter container
kubectl exec -it $( kubectl get pods -n $ns |grep itom-toolkit | awk '{print $1}' | head -1) bash -n $ns -c itom-toolkit
# find the mount path
df -h

    Where <ESM_NAMESPACE> is the unique namespace of the ESM Helm chart deployment.

  2. Enter the relevant log paths (see Where to find logs (Helm deployment) ) and find the log files and folders.
    For example, in a helm deployment, the log path for Smart Analytics is either /var/vols/itom/itsma/logging-volume/smartanalytics or /logging-volume/smartanalytics. For other applications such as IDM/BO/xruntime, the log path is either  /var/vols/itom/itsma/logging-volume or /logging-volume. 

    The table below provides the command that will facilitate your log investigation and management.

    Command Description

    ls -lrt

    		 List files or directories and sort by modification time in ascending order (oldest to latest).

  3. Compress all files and folders into one package with command tar or gz and put the package under the /var/log of itom-toolkit container.

    # go to log path inside container
cd /logging-volume/logs/xservices/platform
# package file
tar -cvzf /var/log/itom-xruntime-platform-offline-xxxxxxxxx-xxxxx-2021-xx-xx.tgz itom-xruntime-platform-offline-xxxxxxxxx-xxxxx-2021-xx-xx
